tips: Always be aware of your surroundings, especially in unfamiliar areas.
Trust your instincts and avoid risky situations or people.
When walking or jogging alone, choose well-lit paths and vary your route.
Lock all doors and windows when you're at home or away.
Consider installing a security system to protect your home.
Use timers for lights and appliances to create the appearance of occupancy when you're not home.
Protect your personal information online by using strong, unique passwords.
Be cautious of phishing scams and never click on suspicious links or download unknown attachments.
Report any instances of cyberbullying or online harassment to the appropriate authorities or platforms.
Keep your belongings secure when traveling and avoid displaying valuable items.
Stay cautious in unfamiliar places and avoid risky areas, especially at night.
Carry emergency contact numbers and know the location of your country's embassy when traveling internationally.
Learn basic self-defense techniques, such as how to break free from a wrist grab.
Consider enrolling in a self-defense class to build your skills and confidence.
Remember that physical confrontation should be a last resort; your safety is the top priority.
